   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between two Diameter nodes, the server being
   23: %% spread across three Erlang nodes.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_dist_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% all tests, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([suite/0,
   33:          all/0,
   34:          traffic/1]).
   35: 
   36: %% diameter callbacks
   37: -export([peer_up/3,
   38:          peer_down/3,
   39:          pick_peer/4,
   40:          prepare_request/3,
   41:          prepare_retransmit/3,
   42:          handle_answer/4,
   43:          handle_error/4,
   44:          handle_request/3]).
   45: 
   46: %% rpc calls
   47: -export([start/1,
   48:          call/1,
   49:          connect/1,
   50:          ping/1]).
   51: 
   52: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   53: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc6733.hrl").
   54: 
   55: %% ===========================================================================
   56: 
   57: -define(util, diameter_util).
   58: 
   59: -define(CLIENT, 'CLIENT').
   60: -define(SERVER, 'SERVER').
   61: -define(REALM, "erlang.org").
   62: -define(DICT, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733).
   63: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   64: 
   65: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   66: -define(SERVICE(Host),
   67:         [{'Origin-Host', Host ++ [$.|?REALM]},
   68:          {'Origin-Realm', ?REALM},
   69:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   70:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   71:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   72:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [?DICT:id()]},
   73:          {'Origin-State-Id', origin()},
   74:          {spawn_opt, {diameter_dist, route_session, [#{id => []}]}},
   75:          {sequence, fun sequence/0},
   76:          {string_decode, false},
   77:          {application, [{dictionary, ?DICT},
   78:                         {module, ?MODULE},
   79:                         {request_errors, callback},
   80:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
   81: 
   82: -define(SUCCESS, 2001).
   83: -define(BUSY,    3004).
   84: -define(LOGOUT,  ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
   85: -define(MOVED,   ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_USER_MOVED').
   86: -define(TIMEOUT, ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_SESSION_TIMEOUT').
   87: 
   88: -define(L, atom_to_list).
   89: -define(A, list_to_atom).
   90: 
   91: %% The order here is significant and causes the server to listen
   92: %% before the clients connect. The server listens on the first node,
   93: %% and distributes requests to the other two.
   94: -define(NODES, [{server0, ?SERVER},
   95:                 {server1, ?SERVER},
   96:                 {server2, ?SERVER},
   97:                 {client, ?CLIENT}]).
   98: 
   99: %% ===========================================================================
  100: %% common_test wrapping
  101: 
  102: suite() ->
  103:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  104: 
  105: all() ->
  106:     [traffic].
  107: 
  108: traffic(_Config) ->
  109:     run().
  110: 
  111: %% ===========================================================================
  112: 
  113: %% run/0
  114: 
  115: run() ->
  116:     [] = ?util:run([{fun traffic/0, 60000}]).
  117:     %% process for linked peers to die with
  118: 
  119: %% traffic/0
  120: 
  121: traffic() ->
  122:     true = is_alive(),  %% need distribution for peer nodes
  123:     Nodes = enslave(),
  124:     [] = ping(lists:droplast(Nodes)),  %% drop client node
  125:     [] = start(Nodes),
  126:     ok = connect(Nodes),
  127:     ok = send(Nodes).
  128: 
  129: %% enslave/1
  130: %%
  131: %% Start four slave nodes, three to implement a Diameter server,
  132: %% one to implement a client.
  133: 
  134: enslave() ->
  135:     Here = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  136:     Ebin = filename:join([Here, "..", "ebin"]),
  137:     Args = ["-pa", Here, Ebin],
  138:     [{N,S} || {M,S} <- ?NODES, N <- [start(M, Args)]].
  139: 
  140: start(Name, Args) ->
  141:     {ok, _, Node} = ?util:peer(#{name => Name, args => Args}),
  142:     Node.
  143: 
  144: %% ping/1
  145: %%
  146: %% Ensure the server nodes are connected so that diameter_dist can attach.
  147: 
  148: ping({S, Nodes}) ->
  149:     ?SERVER = S,  %% assert
  150:     [N || {N,_} <- Nodes,
  151:           node() /= N,
  152:           pang <- [net_adm:ping(N)]];
  153: 
  154: ping(Nodes) ->
  155:     [{N,RC} || {N,S} <- Nodes,
  156:                RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, ping, [{S,Nodes}])],
  157:                RC /= []].
  158: 
  159: %% start/1
  160: %%
  161: %% Start diameter services.
  162: 
  163: %% There's no need to start diameter on a node that only services
  164: %% diameter_dist as a handler of incoming requests, but the
  165: %% diameter_dist server must be started since the servers communicate
  166: %% to determine who services what. The typical case is probably that
  167: %% handler nodes also want to be able to send Diameter requests, in
  168: %% which case the application needs to be started and diameter_dist is
  169: %% started as a part of this, but only start the server here to ensure
  170: %% everything still works as expected.
  171: start({_SvcName, [_, {S1, _}, {S2, _}, _]})
  172:   when node() == S1;    %% server1
  173:        node() == S2 ->  %% server2
  174:     Mod = diameter_dist,
  175:     {ok, _} = gen_server:start({local, Mod}, Mod, _Args = [], _Opts  = []),
  176:     ok;
  177: 
  178: start({SvcName, [{S0, _}, _, _, {C, _}]})
  179:   when node() == S0;    %% server0
  180:        node() == C ->   %% client
  181:     ok = diameter:start(),
  182:     ok = diameter:start_service(SvcName, ?SERVICE((?L(SvcName))));
  183: 
  184: start(Nodes) ->
  185:     [{N,RC} || {N,S} <- Nodes,
  186:                RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start, [{S, Nodes}])],
  187:                RC /= ok].
  188: 
  189: sequence() ->
  190:     sequence(sname()).
  191: 
  192: sequence(client) ->
  193:     {0,32};
  194: sequence(Server) ->
  195:     "server" ++ N = ?L(Server),
  196:     {list_to_integer(N), 30}.
  197: 
  198: origin() ->
  199:     origin(sname()).
  200: 
  201: origin(client) ->
  202:     99;
  203: origin(Server) ->
  204:     "server" ++ N = ?L(Server),
  205:     list_to_integer(N).
  206: 
  207: %% connect/1
  208: %%
  209: %% Establish one connection from the client, terminated on the first
  210: %% server node, the others handling requests.
  211: 
  212: connect({?SERVER, [{Node, _} | _], []})
  213:   when Node == node() ->  %% server0
  214:     [_LRef = ?util:listen(?SERVER, tcp)];
  215: 
  216: connect({?SERVER, _, [_] = Acc}) -> %% server[12]: register to receive requests
  217:     ok = diameter_dist:attach([?SERVER]),
  218:     Acc;
  219: 
  220: connect({?CLIENT, [{Node, _} | _], [LRef]}) ->
  221:     ?util:connect(?CLIENT, tcp, {Node, LRef}),
  222:     ok;
  223: 
  224: connect(Nodes) ->
  225:     lists:foldl(fun({N,S}, A) ->
  226:                         rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, connect, [{S, Nodes, A}])
  227:                 end,
  228:                 [],
  229:                 Nodes).
  230: 
  231: %% ===========================================================================
  232: %% traffic testcases
  233: 
  234: %% send/1
  235: %%
  236: %% Send 100 requests and ensure the node name sent as User-Name isn't
  237: %% the node terminating transport.
  238: 
  239: send(Nodes) ->
  240:     send(Nodes, 100, dict:new()).
  241: 
  242: %% send/2
  243: 
  244: send(Nodes, 0, Dict) ->
  245:     [{Server0, _} | _] = Nodes,
  246:     Node = atom_to_binary(Server0, utf8),
  247:     {false, _} = {dict:is_key(Node, Dict), dict:to_list(Dict)},
  248:     %% Check that counters have been incremented as expected on server0.
  249:     [Info] = rpc:call(Server0, diameter, service_info, [?SERVER, connections]),
  250:     {[Stats], _} = {[S || {statistics, S} <- Info], Info},
  251:     {[{recv, 1, 100}, {send, 0, 100}], _}
  252:         = {[{D,R,N} || T <- [recv, send],
  253:                        {{{0,275,R}, D}, N} <- Stats,
  254:                        D == T],
  255:            Stats},
  256:     {[{send, 0, 100, 2001}], _}
  257:         = {[{D,R,N,C} || {{{0,275,R}, D, {'Result-Code', C}}, N} <- Stats],
  258:            Stats},
  259:     ok;
  260: 
  261: send(Nodes, N, Dict) ->
  262:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  263:                        'User-Name' = [ServerNode]}
  264:         = send(Nodes, str(?LOGOUT)),
  265:     true = is_binary(ServerNode),
  266:     send(Nodes, N-1, dict:update_counter(ServerNode, 1, Dict)).
  267: 
  268: %% ===========================================================================
  269: 
  270: str(Cause) ->
  271:     #diameter_base_STR{'Destination-Realm'   = ?REALM,
  272:                        'Auth-Application-Id' = ?DICT:id(),
  273:                        'Termination-Cause'   = Cause}.
  274: 
  275: %% send/2
  276: 
  277: send(Nodes, Req) ->
  278:     {Node, _} = lists:last(Nodes),
  279:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, call, [Req]).
  280: 
  281: %% call/1
  282: 
  283: call(Req) ->
  284:     diameter:call(?CLIENT, ?DICT, Req, []).
  285: 
  286: %% sname/0
  287: 
  288: sname() ->
  289:     ?A(hd(string:tokens(?L(node()), "@"))).
  290: 
  291: %% ===========================================================================
  292: %% diameter callbacks
  293: 
  294: %% peer_up/3
  295: 
  296: peer_up(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  297:     State.
  298: 
  299: %% peer_down/3
  300: 
  301: peer_down(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  302:     State.
  303: 
  304: %% pick_peer/4
  305: 
  306: pick_peer([Peer], [], ?CLIENT, _State) ->
  307:     {ok, Peer}.
  308: 
  309: %% prepare_request/3
  310: 
  311: prepare_request(Pkt, ?CLIENT, {_Ref, Caps}) ->
  312:     #diameter_packet{msg = Req}
  313:         = Pkt,
  314:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  315:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  316:         = Caps,
  317:     {send, Req#diameter_base_STR{'Origin-Host' = OH,
  318:                                  'Origin-Realm' = OR,
  319:                                  'Session-Id' = diameter:session_id(OH)}}.
  320: 
  321: %% prepare_retransmit/3
  322: 
  323: prepare_retransmit(_, ?CLIENT, _) ->
  324:     discard.
  325: 
  326: %% handle_answer/5
  327: 
  328: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer) ->
  329:     #diameter_packet{msg = Rec, errors = []} = Pkt,
  330:     Rec.
  331: 
  332: %% handle_error/5
  333: 
  334: handle_error(Reason, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer) ->
  335:     {error, Reason}.
  336: 
  337: %% handle_request/3
  338: 
  339: handle_request(Pkt, ?SERVER, {_, Caps}) ->
  340:     #diameter_packet{msg = #diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = SId}}
  341:         = Pkt,
  342:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  343:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  344:         = Caps,
  345:     {reply, #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  346:                                'Session-Id' = SId,
  347:                                'Origin-Host' = OH,
  348:                                'Origin-Realm' = OR,
  349:                                'User-Name' = [atom_to_binary(node(), utf8)]}}.
